Lucas Li

Competition Manager at Solar Decathlon China

Motivated engineering graduate. Having education background in both Mechanical and Architectural Engineering. Equipped with professional skills in building energy modeling, daylight analysis, CFD simulation, HVAC and sustainable design. Interested in pursuing a full-time position in Building/Mechanical fields, specifically in Building energy modeling & analysis; HVAC/Lighting design; Green building/sustainable design, etc.

Experience

Competition Manager at Solar Decathlon China
August 2016 - current
  • Developed the Team Service Center website with Jekyll and hosted in Github.
  • Updated the competition Rules and Building Code.
Graduate Student Researcher at Purdue University
June 2014 - June 2015
  • Cooperated with Taiwan Ziolar Technology Co. Ltd. to develop the building integrated solar thermal shading (BISTS) system.
  • Developed building energy model, daylight model, CFD model, and solar hydraulic model in EnergyPlus, Daysim, ANSYS, and TRNSYS.
  • Provided simulation support to predict the performance of BISTS system based on a medium office building (54,000 ft2) located in Los Angeles.
  • Conducted parametric study to streamline the BISTS design. Investigated the configuration parameters such as slat angle, depth, height, and shading-to-window ratio of the BISTS system.
